tr: an informant who exposes wrongdoing within an organization in the hope of stopping it
example: the law gives little protection to whistleblowers who feel the public has a right to know what is going on
the whistleblower was fired for exposing the conditions in mental hospitals

example.ex: He has been a prominent victim of alleged witch-hunts against whistle-blowers in the NHS.
example.tran: 他成了英国国民保健制度下所谓追查报复检举者行动的典型牺牲品。

value.def: A whistle-blower is someone who finds out that the organization they are working for is doing something immoral or illegal and tells the authorities or the public about it.
